question:
Which among the following financial reforms was/ were taken by Lord Lytton?
1. He followed a policy of free trade
2. He took initiatives to continue the financial decentralization policy of Lord Mayo
3. He equalized the salt tax in every part of India
Choose the correct option from the codes given below :
explanation: Lord Lytton followed a policy of free trade by abolishing duties on 29 commodities and removing 5% duties on cotton cloth. Previously the salt tax was levied differently from different states. He equalized the salt tax in every part of India with the help of John Strachey.Â  Lord Mayo took the initiative of financial decentralization. Lytton continued his policy by providing more departments and sources of revenue to the provinces.
